text: The District Department of Transportation shall develop and implement a plan to create and post special signs with the following or substantially similar notation: "D.C. Law: Failure to stop for pedestrians in crosswalk punishable by $250 fine". The signs shall be posted at selected District crosswalks and intersections to alert motorists of the fine for this infraction. The Director of the District Department of Transportation shall be responsible for determining which crosswalks and intersections shall have the signs.
historical:
Effect of Amendments

D.C. Law 19-171, in the section heading, validated a previously made technical correction.

Legislative History of Laws

For Law 17-269, see notes following § 50-2201.28.

For history of Law 19-171, see notes under § 50-921.02.

DC CODE § 50-2201.30

Current through December 11, 2012

title.text: Motor and Non-Motor Vehicles and Traffic. (Refs & Annos)

heading.catch_text: Special signs for failure to yield to pedestrians in crosswalks.
